labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issues.title: Dhruv's comments
issues.author: boucadair
issues.body:
- It would be good to also expand on how the manual system works for a reader to be able to appreciate the motivation for native integration. 
- Explain the relationship between message broker (in initial sections) and Time Series DB (in section 3). The figure in section 3 does not have any mention of YANG message broker producer and consumer for instance. 
- Section 4 and 5 are better suited as appendix
- Section 7, consider using RFC 7942 template
- Use RFC 8792to handle long lines

issues.title: Feng's comments
issues.author: boucadair
issues.body:
I suggest use yang library of one network node to build one YANG schema context, and then register to schema register instead of registeration per subscription. It may cause many unuseful yang modules, but it should be helpful for any data validation and need not modify yang library definition(e.g. add augmention list).
  Anydata node, I think, MUST be validated by the schema context which it belongs to, it's not really modelled by any YANG schema.

issues.title: Andy's comment
issues.author: boucadair
issues.body:
I think the scope of this standards work is very important, and quite challenging to get right.

We have a program (work-in-progress) called yangcli-gw, but it is not open-source.
The documentation is publicly available
[https://docs.yumaworks.com/en/latest/yangcli-gw/introduction.html](https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.yumaworks.com%2Fen%2Flatest%2Fyangcli-gw%2Fintroduction.html&data=05%7C02%7Cmohamed.boucadair%40orange.com%7Cd020c17f5c4b4fa545fd08dc660be874%7C90c7a20af34b40bfbc48b9253b6f5d20%7C0%7C0%7C638497448531477362%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=huRFIslYiVvZ7wOsCpoQU%2F%2BF%2FYl6CLE8eIh87JBdALE%3D&reserved=0)

I created a protocol called ZMQAPI
[https://docs.yumaworks.com/en/latest/yangcli-gw/zmqapi-intro.html](https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.yumaworks.com%2Fen%2Flatest%2Fyangcli-gw%2Fzmqapi-intro.html&data=05%7C02%7Cmohamed.boucadair%40orange.com%7Cd020c17f5c4b4fa545fd08dc660be874%7C90c7a20af34b40bfbc48b9253b6f5d20%7C0%7C0%7C638497448531496921%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=eX2EMQZEqPAm3ZBlPKte1fSUEJ8BSuLSCQVi%2FRnUtCg%3D&reserved=0)

It uses a YANG module to define structures to represent the message layers
[https://github.com/YumaWorks/yumapro-yang/blob/main/yumaworks/yumaworks-zmqapi.yang](https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2FYumaWorks%2Fyumapro-yang%2Fblob%2Fmain%2Fyumaworks%2Fyumaworks-zmqapi.yang&data=05%7C02%7Cmohamed.boucadair%40orange.com%7Cd020c17f5c4b4fa545fd08dc660be874%7C90c7a20af34b40bfbc48b9253b6f5d20%7C0%7C0%7C638497448531511644%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=kstufRfSt5ORZ%2FT7nk4NMhiURkzOvs2AxsM3SoLKX%2F4%3D&reserved=0)

IMO it should be possible to define the message format as a YANG structure in 1 draft
and message broker bindings in other drafts.

issues.title: Qin's comments
issues.author: boucadair
issues.body:
A few comments for your considering:
1.	For YANG-Push to Message Broker Integration, as described in section 1.3, both configured subscription and dynamic subscription can be supported, however look at the end to end work flow in figure 1, only static subscription or configured subscription is supported, see step (2) (4), can you clarify whether dynamic subscription is supported?
2.	Given client server series drafts have been moved to RFC queue for publication, have you considered to implement these client server series draft and integrated them into message broker?
3.	How do you see the difference between this work and draft-lindblad-tlm-philatelist, especially time series database integration
4.	[I-D.tgraf-netconf-yang-push-observation-time] introduce two type of timestamps, I am wondering whether these two type of timestamps will be used as time stamp for time series database or 
Time Series Database Ingestion will generate its own timestamp when receiving Kafka message?
